I can ask this question a decent amount.
Am I disciplined because I was in the Navy
or am I disciplined because I am disciplined?

I think the training that you received in the Navy

And I think goals are important.
I mean, if you have no goals in your life,
nothing that's meaningful and purposeful for you
to work toward.
But the hell are you going to be disciplined about?
I mean, you're going to be kind of like
just drifting one way or the other.

your goal to be a seal, your goal venture
where a seal to be a seal commander, etc., etc.,

So I think it's probably a little bit of both,

Then you think that's the same for you then?
Well, I do.
I think if I didn't take the path,
I did by getting into an army.
I probably wouldn't have had the benefit of those NCOs

in order to achieve something you really got to work hard for.
Now, yeah, when I was growing up as a kid,

it's kind of, I think, building blocks
along to weighing your life.

to get out there on a field
and not get yourself beat up, right?

So I think it's really like building block

And then you just continue with it.
Yeah, I think I was, I don't know if this is luck,

if I didn't work hard, I was going to look like an idiot.

That's definitely the, that definitely influenced my path

I think if I would have been a natural,
